item.ptxt: Confirm the sheet thickness, tensile strength, and existence of the zinc treatment of both sides, and set the welder to conform to the welding conditions by referring to Roof and Side Panel Construction.
Welding symbols (The welding symbols with dashed lines have a meaning of the spot welding of the part which is not visible)

s1.ptxt: Clamp the new roof panel, the front roof rail, roof arch A, and the rear roof rail, and check the body dimensions:

ptxt.sie-ref03: Rear pillar gutter and rear panel positions

s1.ptxt: Tack weld the new front roof rail, roof arch A, and the rear roof rail.

Temporarily install the windshield, the windshield side trim, the roof moldings, the tailgate, and the doors, then check for differences in level and clearance. Check the external parts fitting positions. Make sure the body lines flow smoothly.
Weld the front roof rail (B), roof arch A, and the rear roof rail (C).
( )*: Welding positions with MPa or higher parts. Confirm the plug welding conditions.
Apply a soft type sealer (B) to mating surfaces of the front roof rail (C), roof arch A, and the rear roof rail (D).
Clamp the roof panel, and recheck the clearance and alignment of the windshield, the tailgate, and the outer panel.
Do the main welding.Weld the front, rear, and side flanges of the roof panel (A) and both sides edge of the rear roof rail.
()*: Welding positions with the front pillar upper stiffener (B), high-strength steel ( MPa) parts. Perform the spot welding on the conditions of No. in the table shown below.
